topics.body:
You know what I fucking hate:
When a school book is wrong and you try to bring it up to the teacher and they use the, "It can't be wrong if the majority of people think it's right" fallacy.

In my programming class one of the equations was complete bullshit math wise and I was trying to explain to him for ten minutes why the equation was wrong and he kept going, "You're the only person that's having trouble with it so you're wrong", "No; here's the mathematical steps to carry out the formula; the book is wrong" and now I'm having to do the formula the correct way to which he's probably going to take points off for the fact that unlike the rest of the class I do NOT suck at math.  That's bullshit; math is a pure science, therefore if something is wrong with your equation math wise YOU'RE wrong.

Tl:dr; my teacher sucks at math.



Also holy crap:
!http://i1.kym-cdn.com/photos/images/original/000/780/649/8a1.png!
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
